main_text:
Johannes Sharpe (ca. 1360–after 1415) is the most important
and original author among the so called “Oxford Realists”,
a group of thinkers influenced by John Wyclif’s logic and
ontology. His semantic and metaphysical theories are the culmination
of the main preceding traditions of thought, since he developed the
new form of realism begun by Wyclif, on the one hand, but was open to
many nominalist criticisms of the traditional realist strategies, on
the other.
